{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Fortress Technology |model=ES2440 |revision=-3555 |manuf= |manuf_model= |availability= |type=mesh node |fcc_id=WYK-ES2440 |ic_id=8190A-ES2440 |pwr_v= |pwr_amp= |pwr_conn= |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_poe=at |cpu1_brand= |cpu1_model= |cpu1_cspeed= |fla1= |fla1_brand= |fla1_model= |ram1= |ram1_brand= |ram1_model= |ram1_num= |expansion_if_types=Mini PCI |expansion_minipci_num=4 |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num= |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |serial= |jtag= |wi1_module=Ubiquiti Networks SR71-M5 |wi1_module_if=Mini PCI |wi1_chip1_brand=Atheros |wi1_chip1_model=AR9220 |wi1_chip2_brand= |wi1_chip2_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=an |wi1_ant_conn=MMCX |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |wi2_module=Ubiquiti Networks SR71-M25 |wi2_module_if=Mini PCI |wi2_chip1_brand=Atheros |wi2_chip1_model=AR9220 |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols=abgn |wi2_ant_conn=MMCX |wi2_txchains=2 |wi2_rxchains=2 |wi2_sstreams=2 |sw_cpu= |sw_brand= |sw_model= |eth_none= |eth_cpu= |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand= |eth_chip2_model= |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=3 |wan_ports= |flags=military grade,more than 2 wireless interfaces |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=abgn |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ch= |default_ip= |default_user= |default_pass= |oui= |oui_eth= }} {{TagLine|ES2440 High Capacity Infrastructure Mesh Point}}
[http://www.gdfortress.com/Products-Article/es2440.html ES2440 on Fortress Technologies' site]
This device has four wireless modules in the FCC photos. *Ubiquiti Networks SR71-M25 **There does not seem to be any reference to this device on the (current) internet. **'''AR9220''' (AR9220-AC1A), 00:15:6D OUI (on the label, anyway) **Per Fortress' specs, this radio is a/b/g/n w/ 250mW transmit power *Ubiquiti Networks SR71-M5 **There does not seem to be any reference to this device on the (current) internet. **'''AR9220''', 00:15:6D OUI (on the label, anyway) **Per Fortress' specs, this radio is a/n w/ 50mW transmit power
This device has a 1GB Netlist Industrial Grade CompactFlash card. There are three Ethernet ports on the board and one serial port.
There are a total of 8 Winbond RAM chips on the board, two Spansion Flash chips, two IDT chips, and a Trimble GPS module.
